'Hobart'  is the state capital and most populous city of the
Australian island state of Tasmania. Founded in 1804 as a penal
colony, Frank Bolt, The Founding of Hobart 1803â1804, ISBN 0-9757166-0-
3 Hobart is Australia's second oldest capital city after Sydney, New South
Wales. In 2011, the city had a greater area population of approximately
216,656. A resident of Hobart is known as a "Hobartian".
The city is located in the state's south-east on the estuary of the Derwent
River. The skyline is dominated by Mount Wellington at 1,271 metres
(4,170 ft) high. The city is the financial and administrative heart of
Tasmania, also serving as the home port for both Australian and French Antarctic
operations.
headings: Gateway to Antarctica and the Southern Ocean
